thread.title: Tottenham Hotspur keeper Hugo Lloris pulls off outrageous saves in France training
thread.title_full: Tottenham Hotspur keeper Hugo Lloris pulls off outrageous saves in France training

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Tottenham Hotspur keeper Hugo Lloris pulls off outrageous saves in France training
text:
Tottenham Hotspur keeper Hugo Lloris pulls off outrageous saves in France training L'Equipe's number one looks on fire - which is a very good thing for Spurs Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Hugo Lloris pulls off super saves in training Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Hugo Lloris is showing once again why he's one of the best goalkeepers in the world. 
The 30-year-old linked up with his national side earlier this week ahead of France's 2018 World Cup qualifier against Luxembourg. 
L'Equipe also face Spain in a friendly on Tuesday. 
But if any of you thought international training was easygoing compared to club level workouts, just take one look at the video above. 
Lloris is put through an intense looking drill forcing him to get up and down and make save after save. This is why Hugo Lloris is one of the best goalkeepers in the world The 30-year-old linked up with France earlier this week (Photo: Getty) 
The Frenchman produces one outrageous save in particular. Roughly halfway through the video, Lloris brilliantly arcs his body to tip the ball over the bar. 
Spurs will be pleased to see their keeper in such fine fettle. The north Londoners will be reliant on their number one if they're to have any chance of catching Chelsea in the Premier League. poll loading Who is the best goalkeeper in the Premier League? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
